edu.iastate.cs309.comminterfaces
Interface IServer

All Known Implementing Classes:
Server
public interface IServer

A Server object must implement these methods (and hopefully send something back). A Client object can call these methods.

Author:
Michael Seibert

Method Summary
 void addTorrent(String name, InputStream dotTorrentFile)
          Instructs the server to add a new torrent.
 void changeServerProp(ServerProperties setting)
          Changes a setting on the server.

          Changes a setting for a torrent.
 void getAllTorrents(int clientID)
          Instructs the server that the client would like a list of all torrents.

          Instructs the server that the client would like a list of all server properties.
 void getTorrentInfo(int clientID, int refID)
          Instructs the server that the client would like a list of all information about a torrent.
 void getTorrentProp(int clientID, int refID)
          Instructs the server that the client would like a list of all properties of a torrent.
 void removeTorrent(int refID)
          Removes the torrent with the specified refID
 void shutdown()
          Shut down the server

          Instructs the server that the client would like to transfer the data of one or more files from the server to the client.
 

Method Detail

addTorrent

void addTorrent(String name,
                InputStream dotTorrentFile)
                throws edu.iastate.cs309.clientserverprotocol.exceptions.FailedMessageException
Instructs the server to add a new torrent. The new torrent will be added, and the client will be informed of the new torrent via the Client.torrentList(java.util.List) method.

Parameters:
dotTorrentFile - An InputStream containing the data of the torrent to be added.
name - of torrent file
Throws:
edu.iastate.cs309.clientserverprotocol.exceptions.FailedMessageException - If the message could not be successfully sent.

changeTorrentProp

void changeTorrentProp(int refID,
                       TorrentProp prop)
                       throws edu.iastate.cs309.clientserverprotocol.exceptions.FailedMessageException
Changes a setting for a torrent. The setting will be changed, and the client will be informed of the changed setting via the Client.updateTorrentProperties(int, edu.iastate.cs309.communication.TorrentProp) method.

Parameters:
refID - The ID of the torrent whose properties are being changed
prop - The new torrent properties
Throws:
edu.iastate.cs309.clientserverprotocol.exceptions.FailedMessageException - If the message could not be successfully sent.

changeServerProp

void changeServerProp(ServerProperties setting)
                      throws edu.iastate.cs309.clientserverprotocol.exceptions.FailedMessageException
Changes a setting on the server. The setting will be changed, and the client will be informed of the changed setting via the Client.updateServerStatus(edu.iastate.cs309.communication.ServerProperties) method.

Parameters:
setting - The new server setting
Throws:
edu.iastate.cs309.clientserverprotocol.exceptions.FailedMessageException - If the message could not be successfully sent.

transferTorrent

void transferTorrent(int clientID,
                     int refID,
                     List<Integer> fileIndex)
                     throws edu.iastate.cs309.clientserverprotocol.exceptions.FailedMessageException
Instructs the server that the client would like to transfer the data of one or more files from the server to the client. The data will be sent asynchronously via the Client.transferFiles(int, java.util.List, java.util.List) method, so that the client remains responsive while the list is sent.

Parameters:
clientID - The ID of the client requesting the information.
refID - The ID of the torrent to be transferred
fileIndex - The indexes of the files within the torrent to download
Throws:
edu.iastate.cs309.clientserverprotocol.exceptions.FailedMessageException - If the message could not be successfully sent.

getTorrentInfo

void getTorrentInfo(int clientID,
                    int refID)
                    throws edu.iastate.cs309.clientserverprotocol.exceptions.FailedMessageException
Instructs the server that the client would like a list of all information about a torrent. The list will be sent asynchronously via the Client.updateTorrentInformation(int, edu.iastate.cs309.communication.TorrentInfo) method, so that the client remains responsive while the list is sent.

Parameters:
clientID - The ID of the client requesting the information.
refID - The ID of the torrent whose properties are requested.
Throws:
edu.iastate.cs309.clientserverprotocol.exceptions.FailedMessageException - If the message could not be successfully sent.

getTorrentProp

void getTorrentProp(int clientID,
                    int refID)
                    throws edu.iastate.cs309.clientserverprotocol.exceptions.FailedMessageException
Instructs the server that the client would like a list of all properties of a torrent. The list will be sent asynchronously via the Client.updateTorrentProperties(int, edu.iastate.cs309.communication.TorrentProp) method, so that the client remains responsive while the list is sent.

Parameters:
clientID - The ID of the client requesting the information.
refID - The ID of the torrent whose properties are requested.
Throws:
edu.iastate.cs309.clientserverprotocol.exceptions.FailedMessageException - If the message could not be successfully sent.

getServerProp

void getServerProp(int clientID)
                   throws edu.iastate.cs309.clientserverprotocol.exceptions.FailedMessageException
Instructs the server that the client would like a list of all server properties. The list will be sent asynchronously via the Client.updateServerStatus(edu.iastate.cs309.communication.ServerProperties) method, so that the client remains responsive while the list is sent.

Parameters:
clientID - The ID of the client requesting the information.
Throws:
edu.iastate.cs309.clientserverprotocol.exceptions.FailedMessageException - If the message could not be successfully sent.

getAllTorrents

void getAllTorrents(int clientID)
                    throws edu.iastate.cs309.clientserverprotocol.exceptions.FailedMessageException
Instructs the server that the client would like a list of all torrents. The list will be sent asynchronously via the Client.torrentList(java.util.List) method, so that the client remains responsive while the list is sent.

Parameters:
clientID - The ID of the client requesting the information.
Throws:
edu.iastate.cs309.clientserverprotocol.exceptions.FailedMessageException - If the message could not be successfully sent.
